task.title: How to Use a Bullet Instead Numbering for Tasks with a Single Step

context.p: If there is only one step (step element) it should display a disc symbol before it instead of the decimal number.
Should be rendered as: o The stepInstead of: 1. The step

To solve this you will need to create an XSLT template that adds a special outputclass attribute (with the value single) to the single step, then you need to match this attribute from the CSS and change its aspect.

info.codeblock: <xsl:template match="*[contains(@class, ' task/step ')][count(../*[contains(@class, ' task/step ')]) = 1]"> <xsl:copy> <xsl:copy-of select="@*"/> <xsl:attribute name="outputclass" select="concat(@outputclass, ' single ')"/> <xsl:apply-templates/> </xsl:copy> </xsl:template>
